entry.title: Worklist plugin, show customer name
entry.content:
In the default plugin of the worklist i have a column 'Customer' available.
However this column only shows the customer number, but I also want the name of the customer (as shown in the 'Manage order' app).
Is there an option to add this column in the worklist or even in the SFC card plugin?

entry.title: Re: Success factor beginning
entry.content:
Hi Ernesto, 

Do you have access to the SAP Learning Hub? If not , I would recommend getting a license for this, as it is where all of the online and classroom learning can be found. There are different versions of the learning hub depending on whether you are a student/ customer or partner. So I recommend checking with your company first if they have these licenses and if not looking at the version that fits best. 

Once you have access there are different courses for each of the SuccessFactors Modules - (for example Employee Central, Recruiting etc.) so which one to complete depends on the module that you want/ need to learn about. 

But you said you wanted a starter overview, so I would recommend this course which gives an overall overview accross the entire solution and is tailored for beginners. 
https://learning.sap.com/courses/hire-to-retire-strategy-implementation-and-operations

Best of luck with your learning journey. 
Paul

entry.title: Re: How can we pull all records daily by using Dataflows
entry.content: Hi Oleh_Ilchyshyn1! I've tried this approach - it works but there is one problem I can't get around - as stated accounts.search endpoint has 10000 limit - and since Dataflows are not really flexible, I can't take advantage of openCursor and cursorId that search endpoint offers in order to extract all of the customers.

entry.title: Shaping the Future of SAP Cloud ALM: Join My Sessions at SAP TechEd in Berlin
entry.content:
At SAP TechEd 2025 in Berlin, I’m excited to lead two sessions that dive deep into how SAP Cloud ALM is evolving into an intelligent, autonomous platform that redefines how organizations manage their SAP landscapes. 

If you’re guiding your company’s cloud transformation or planning your move from SAP Solution Manager to SAP Cloud ALM, these sessions are for you. 

Before I share what I'm going to present about in SAP TechEd Berlin, I would like to share with you some background information. 

 

SAP’s ALM strategy and vision 

Application Lifecycle Management (ALM) is the backbone of enterprise IT, orchestrating the full lifecycle of applications - from design and build, through migration and service delivery, to ongoing operations. 

SAP’s vision is to evolve SAP Cloud ALM into a transformation execution platform, supporting the full lifecycle: Scope, Build, Migrate, and Run.  

With the new “Scope” pillar, SAP Cloud ALM will become the central scoping hub by integrating results from the Digital Discovery Assessment (to speed up projects by re-using assessment data), the SAP Readiness Check (to include simplification items), Best Practice Guidance coming from SAP Signavio and information from the Landscape Discovery. 

In “Build”, we plan to strengthen the integration between SAP Signavio and SAP Cloud ALM, and further enrich the existing capabilities of SAP Cloud ALM for process and project management, testing, and deployment management. 

With the also new “Migrate” pillar, we combine and enhance offerings to support customers with data migration for their cloud transformation projects, as well as integrating Custom Code Management capabilities and adding rollout and template management to support large-scale enterprise transformations. 

For the “Run” pillar, SAP plans to move towards autonomous ALM in three steps - from leveraging AI in Integration Monitoring, Health Monitoring, and Business Process Monitoring, through agentic AI use cases to fully autonomous ALM for implementation, powered by embedded AI and Joule agents. 

 

What will I cover at SAP TechEd 2025? 

At SAP TechEd, I am going to cover two different aspects of our ALM strategy: First, I will dive into our plans on leveraging AI in SAP Cloud ALM, and second I will lay out the roadmap of SAP Cloud ALM from an innovation persopective. 

 

Session 1: Strategy for SAP Cloud ALM with Autonomous ALM and Joule 

Session ID: ST106 
When: Tuesday, Nov. 4, 10:15am 

How can artificial intelligence revolutionize the way we manage SAP landscapes? In this strategy session, we’ll explore SAP’s vision for autonomous ALM using SAP Cloud ALM — powered by Joule, SAP’s generative AI copilot. 

You’ll learn how AI agents can proactively identify and resolve operational issues, reducing manual intervention and ensuring continuous, automated system reliability. We’ll also discuss SAP’s roadmap toward a fully autonomous ALM future — where human oversight shifts from problem-solving to strategic innovation. 

 

 

Session 2: Road Map for SAP Cloud ALM 

Session ID: CS805 
When: Tuesday, Nov. 4, 11:45am 

In this deep-dive session, we’ll walk through the latest innovations and upcoming features of SAP Cloud ALM. Expect insights on autonomous capabilities, integrated tool chains, and the role of the Joule copilot in simplifying daily operations. 

We’ll also discuss the SAP Readiness Check for SAP Cloud ALM, designed to help customers plan and execute their transition from SAP Solution Manager with confidence. Whether you’re just getting started with Cloud ALM or looking to optimize existing operations, this session will provide practical guidance for your next steps. 

 

 

Why You Should Attend 

Both sessions are designed to help you understand what’s next for SAP Cloud ALM, but how you can get there. Join me in Berlin to explore how SAP Cloud ALM is evolving into a transformation execution platform powered by broad integrations and meaningful AI - and how your organization can benefit from it today. 

 

Now let’s hear from you: 

What are your most favorite features in SAP Cloud ALM? Let me know in the comments! 

 

#SAP #ALM #CloudALM #Strategy #Roadmap #AI #AutonomousAI

entry.title: UX Loves Innovation: Showcasing the crucial role of User Research
entry.content:
On October 15, we hosted our fourth “UX Loves Innovation” event in Walldorf. This time with a spotlight on current Business Suite UX User Research and Experiences of the Future projects plus one very special guest! 

Celebrating UX and innovation together 
Manoj Swaminathan, SAP Head of Business Suite, Finance, and Spend, and Alex Calvert, Head of SAP Business Suite UX Research & Engagements, kicked off the event with an inspiring half hour talk about the importance of User Research, how customers want to engage and evolve our products with us, and the role that AI and Agents play in our future experiences. Colleagues could spend the following two hours from 10am till lunch to visit the five booths dedicated to research topics in the Business Suite UX organization plus a chance to catch up with colleagues in their own time over coffee and some snacks. 

We were very impressed to see over 150 colleagues from many different areas of SAP with a great interest in user experience and user research stepping by and enjoying the friendly and productive atmosphere. 

Our booths: Five User Research projects for Business Suite UX 

  • Booth 1: GenUI – Welcome to an app-free world! 
    Showcased how dynamically created and personalized SAP user interface can look like. 
  • Booth 2:  Your AI-Powered Research Partner 
    Presented a prototype of an AI-powered assistant designed to scale user research learning and planning. 
  • Booth 3: A Day in a Life of a Billing Clerk 
    Demonstrated research objectives that aim to deeply understand user challenges with real-world billing workflows.
  • Booth 4: The Behavioural Analytics Edge 
    Presented how to decode user behaviour and design delightful experiences with behavioural analytics.
  • Booth 5: SAP Business Suite 
    Focused on the SAP Business Suite strategy, how we co-innovate with customers and how to get access to usage and experience data across the Suite. 

From insights to impact 

What we say about the role of user research in product development also applies to the event: It is so important to meet in one room, bring in an open mind, and have the time to exchange in a diverse group. 

We started these UX Loves Innovation – events in our coffee corner in Walldorf in 2024 as an opportunity for colleagues to meet each other in person, understand what other teams are currently working on and have an exchange across different areas. 

It is such a joy to see how this event developed to a recurring series with more and more colleagues contributing and joining each time. This is a great chance to bring great topics and great people together and we would encourage you to try out your own local version of "UX loves Innovations” yourselves wherever you are in the world. 

SAP has some amazing innovations and ideas that can improve the experience that our customers have today and giving us inspiration and information on how they experiences will evolve in the future. We want to make it simple for our colleagues to have a chance to learn and share in a positive and uplifting environment, and we hope they will also bring their topics for booths for future events as well!

entry.title: Re: Flexible Workflow with Customer Attribute in Responsi...
entry.content:
Dear Roman,
Here is the Solution Provided.
Refer to the issue you are facing, to pass your custom “Resp. Group ID” from a purchase requisition item to the Team determination in Flexible Workflow WS02000471, you should implement the BAdI MMPUR_WORKFLOW_AGENTS_V2 to enrich the responsibility context with your computed attribute.

Let me suggest you the to do without manually querying Teams and Responsibilities Please find below the Key steps to Integrate Custom Responsibility Attribute.

1. Use BAdI MMPUR_WORKFLOW_AGENTS_V2
This BAdI allows you to influence agent determination by enriching the context used in the responsibility rule evaluation. It’s the recommended place to inject custom attributes like your “Resp. Group ID”.

Method to implement: GET_RESPONSIBILITY_CONTEXT

Purpose: Populate the context with custom attributes that will be used in the Team and Responsibility rule evaluation.

2. Access Purchase Requisition Item Data
Within the BAdI implementation, you’ll receive the purchase requisition item ID and other relevant data. Use this to compute your “Resp. Group ID” based on account assignment.

You can use standard APIs or CDS views to fetch account assignment details.

Once computed, add the value to the responsibility_context structure.

3. Ensure Attribute Is Defined in Responsibility Rules
Make sure your custom attribute “Resp. Group ID” is:

Defined in the Manage Responsibility Rules app.

Mapped correctly in the rule conditions.

This ensures the workflow engine can match the enriched context against the defined rules.

4. Avoid Using MMPUR_WORKFLOW_AGENTS
While this older BAdI (MMPUR_WORKFLOW_AGENTS) allows you to set approvers directly, it bypasses the Teams and Responsibilities framework. Stick with MMPUR_WORKFLOW_AGENTS_V2 for a cleaner integration.

I can show you the ABAP code sample

METHOD if_ex_mmpur_workflow_agents_v2~get_responsibility_context.

DATA: lv_resp_group_id TYPE your_custom_type.

" Fetch account assignment data
CALL FUNCTION 'your_custom_logic'
EXPORTING
iv_banfn = is_pr_item-banfn
iv_bnfpo = is_pr_item-bnfpo
IMPORTING
ev_resp_group_id = lv_resp_group_id.

" Add to context
es_context-custom_attributes = VALUE #( ( name = 'RESP_GROUP_ID' value = lv_resp_group_id ) ).

ENDMETHOD.


Let me know if you need more support related to above solution

entry.title: Upload a Document (LOB) to Application using ABAP Restful programming.
entry.content:
Introduction

Uploading large files like Excel sheets or images is a frequent requirement in many business applications. Previously, in RAP-based applications, the only way to handle such uploads was by extending the application and using UI5 tooling to support file uploads manually.

However, with the release of SAP BTP ABAP environment version 2208, the RAP framework has introduced support for OData streams. This enhancement now allows developers to natively manage and process Large Objects (LOBs) directly within RAP applications. It enables end users to upload various external file types — including PDFs, XLSX files, binary formats, and other media — without custom extensions or additional tooling.

In this blog, we’ll walk through how to implement file upload functionality for large objects (like PDFs or binary files) within a standard RAP application, making full use of the new stream handling capabilities — and all without extending the UI manually.

LOB's Model

Large objects are modeled by means of the following fields:

  • Attachment
  • Mimetype
  • Filename

The filed Attachment contains the LOB itself in a RAWSTRING format and is technically bound to the field Mimetype and Filename using semantics annotation.

Mimetype represents the content type of the attachemnt uploaded and the values for the fields. Mimetype and Filename are derived from the field attachment by the RAP framework based on the maintained CDS annotations. No attachment can exist without its mimetype and vice versa.

For example, when a PDF is uploaded the Mimetype field will be derived and populated with 'APPLICATION/PDF'.

Create DB Model for Attachment

A Database table was built as per code snippet below.

The field attachment has a datatype of RAWSTRING. In BTP ABAP  environment we cannot use  RAWSTRING domain directly so create a custom domain with data type as RAWSTRING and Length as '0'. This is important as length being '0' would indicate that the RAWSTRING has No length restriction and can accommodate file of larger size. ZMIMETYPE and ZFILENAME are both of type Character and length 128.

 

@EndUserText.label : 'Invoice header table'
@AbapCatalog.enhancement.category : #NOT_EXTENSIBLE
@AbapCatalog.tableCategory : #TRANSPARENT
@AbapCatalog.deliveryClass : #A
@AbapCatalog.dataMaintenance : #RESTRICTED
define table zsb_inv_hdr {

  key client            : abap.clnt not null;
  key invoice           : ebeln not null;
  comments              : char30;
  vendor_id             : /dmo/customer_id;
  local_created_by      : abp_creation_user;
  local_last_changed_by : abp_locinst_lastchange_user;
  local_last_changed_at : abp_locinst_lastchange_tstmpl;
  last_changed_at       : abp_lastchange_tstmpl;

}

 

@EndUserText.label : 'Table for invoice attachment'
@AbapCatalog.enhancement.category : #NOT_EXTENSIBLE
@AbapCatalog.tableCategory : #TRANSPARENT
@AbapCatalog.deliveryClass : #A
@AbapCatalog.dataMaintenance : #RESTRICTED
define table zsb_inv_att {

  key client    : abap.clnt not null;
  key attach_id : char32 not null;
  invoice       : ebeln not null;
  comments      : char30;
  attachment    : zsb_attachement;
  mimetype      : char128;
  filename      : char128;

}

Design CDS Entities

CDS annotations @Semantics.LargeObject technically binds the Mimetype and Filename to the Attachment.

The annotations contentDispositionPreference can be used to define whether, depending on the browser settings, the file attachment is either displayed in the browser (setting #INLINE) or downloaded when selected  (option #ATTACHMENT). Annotation @Semantics.largeObject. acceptableMimetypes can be used to restrict the Media types which can be uploaded. The validation and Error handling on upload of unsupported media type is handled by RAP framework.

CDS annotation @Semantics.mimetype: true was used to define the field Mimetype as such.

 

@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'Invoice header entity'
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true
define root view entity zi_inv_hdr_sb as select from zsb_inv_hdr
composition[1..*] of zi_inv_att_sb as _Attachemnt
association[1] to /DMO/I_Customer as _Customers on
$projection.VendorId = _Customers.CustomerID
{
    key zsb_inv_hdr.invoice as Invoice,
     @EndUserText.label: 'Comments'
    zsb_inv_hdr.comments as Comments,
    @Consumption.valueHelpDefinition: [{ entity: {name: '/DMO/I_Customer',
                                                  element: 'CustomerID' } }]
    @ObjectModel.text.element: [ 'CustomerName' ]
    zsb_inv_hdr.vendor_id as VendorId,
    _Customers.FirstName as CustomerName,
    @Semantics.user.createdBy: true
    zsb_inv_hdr.local_created_by as LocalCreatedBy,
    @Semantics.user.lastChangedBy: true
    zsb_inv_hdr.local_last_changed_by as LocalLastChangedBy,
    @Semantics.systemDateTime.localInstanceLastChangedAt: true
    zsb_inv_hdr.local_last_changed_at as LocalLastChangedAt,
    @Semantics.systemDateTime.lastChangedAt: true
    zsb_inv_hdr.last_changed_at as LastChangedAt,
    _Attachemnt, // Make association public
    _Customers
}

 

@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'Invoice attachments'
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true
define view entity zi_inv_att_sb as select from zsb_inv_att
association to parent zi_inv_hdr_sb as _Invoice
    on $projection.Invoice = _Invoice.Invoice
{
    key zsb_inv_att.attach_id as AttachId,
    @EndUserText.label: 'Invoice'
    zsb_inv_att.invoice as Invoice,
    @EndUserText.label: 'Comments'
    zsb_inv_att.comments as Comments,
    @EndUserText.label: 'Attachments'
    @Semantics.largeObject : {
    mimeType: 'Mimetype',
    fileName: 'Filename',
    contentDispositionPreference: #INLINE
    }   
    zsb_inv_att.attachment as Attachment,
     @EndUserText.label: 'Type of Document'
    zsb_inv_att.mimetype as Mimetype,
     @EndUserText.label: 'File Type'
    zsb_inv_att.filename as Filename,
    _Invoice.LastChangedAt as LastChangedAt,
    _Invoice // Make association public
}

 

@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'Invoice header projection'
@UI.headerInfo :{ typeName: 'Invoice',
typeNamePlural: 'Invoices',
title.value: 'Invoice',
description.value: 'Comments'
}
define root view entity ZC_INV_HDR_SB as projection on zi_inv_hdr_sb
{
@UI.facet: [{ id: 'InvoiceData',
purpose: #STANDARD,
label: 'Invoice Data',
type: #IDENTIFICATION_REFERENCE,
position: 10
 },
 { id: 'Upload',
    purpose: #STANDARD,
    label: 'Upload your Attachments',
    type: #LINEITEM_REFERENCE,
    targetElement: '_Attachemnt',
    position: 20
     } ]
     
     : { 
     selectionField: [{ position: 10 }],
     lineItem: [{position: 10}],
     identification: [{position: 10}]
     }
    key Invoice,
    : { 
     lineItem: [{position: 20}],
     identification: [{position: 20}]
     }
    Comments,
    : { 
     selectionField: [{ position: 30 }],
     lineItem: [{position: 30}],
     identification: [{position: 30}]
     }
    VendorId,
    CustomerName,
    : { 
     identification: [{position: 40}]
     }
    LocalCreatedBy,
    : { 
     identification: [{position: 50}]
     }
    LocalLastChangedBy,
    LocalLastChangedAt,
    LastChangedAt,
    /* Associations */
    _Attachemnt: redirected to composition child ZC_INV_ATT_SB,
    _Customers
}

 

@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'Consumption view Attachements'
@UI.headerInfo :{ typeName: 'Attachment',
typeNamePlural: 'Attachments',
title.value: 'Filename'
}
define view entity ZC_INV_ATT_SB as projection on ZI_INV_ATT_SB
{
@UI.facet: [{ id: 'AttachmentData',
purpose: #STANDARD,
label: 'Attachment Info',
type: #IDENTIFICATION_REFERENCE,
position: 10
 }]
  : { 
     lineItem: [{position: 10}],
     identification: [{position: 10}]
     }
    key AttachId,
    : { 
     lineItem: [{position: 20}],
     identification: [{position: 20}]
     }
    Invoice,
    : { 
     lineItem: [{position: 30}],
     identification: [{position: 30}]
     }
    Comments,
    : { 
     lineItem: [{position: 40}],
     identification: [{position: 40}]
     }
    Attachment,
    : { 
     lineItem: [{position: 50}],
     identification: [{position: 50}]
     }
    Mimetype,
    : { 
     lineItem: [{position: 60}],
     identification: [{position: 60}]
     }
    Filename,
    /* Associations */
    _Invoice: redirected to parent ZC_INV_HDR_SB
}
 
 
managed implementation in class zbp_i_inv_hdr_sb unique;
strict ;

with draft;
define behavior for zi_inv_hdr_sb alias Invoice
persistent table zsb_inv_hdr
draft table zdr_sb_inv_hdr
lock master
total etag LocalLastChangedAt
authorization master ( global )
etag master LastChangedAt
{
  create ( authorization : global );
  update;
  delete;
  field ( readonly ) Invoice;
  association _Attachemnt { create; with draft; }

  draft action Edit;
  draft action Activate optimized;
  draft action Discard;
  draft action Resume;
  draft determine action Prepare;

  mapping for zsb_inv_hdr {
  Comments = comments;
  Invoice = invoice;
  VendorId = vendor_id;
  LastChangedAt = last_changed_at;
  LocalCreatedBy = local_created_by;
  LocalLastChangedAt = local_last_changed_at;
  LocalLastChangedBy = local_last_changed_by;
  }
}

define behavior for zi_inv_att_sb alias InvoiceAttachment
persistent table zsb_inv_att
draft table zdr_sb_inv_att
lock dependent by _Invoice
authorization dependent by _Invoice
etag master LastChangedAt
{
  update;
  delete;
  field ( readonly ) AttachId, Invoice;
  association _Invoice { with draft; }
  mapping for zsb_inv_att {
  AttachId = attach_id;
  Attachment = attachment;
  Comments = comments;
  Filename = filename;
  Invoice = invoice;
  Mimetype = mimetype;
  }
}

 

projection;
strict ( 1 );
use draft;

define behavior for ZC_INV_HDR_SB //alias <alias_name>
{
  use create;
  use update;
  use delete;

  use action Edit;
  use action Activate;
  use action Discard;
  use action Resume;
  use action Prepare;

  use association _Attachemnt { create; with draft; }
}

define behavior for ZC_INV_ATT_SB //alias <alias_name>
{
  use update;
  use delete;

  use association _Invoice { with draft; }
}

 

@EndUserText.label: 'Service Definition for Invoice attachment'
define service ZSD_SB_INV_ATT_SRV {
  expose ZC_INV_HDR_SB;
  expose ZC_INV_ATT_SB;
  expose /DMO/I_Customer;
}

After Creating and activating the service definition ZSD_SB_INV_ATT_SRV, create the service binding of the type OData V4 - UI ZSB_INV_SB_SRV for the service definition and activate the same. 

Then use this service SAP BAS (Business Application Studio). We will get below screen. Here click on create button. You will get pop up to enter Document number and provide the document number and continue.

 

In Object page provide Invoice number and Customer Id. Then click on create button you will get a pop up to enter attachment Id. This field can be made read only and we can provide internal numbering also.

We will get below page and we can see upload icon. By clicking on this we will be able to upload the respective file.

For this we can do validation and handle the error for unsupported format and so.

Once the upload is complete click on Apply button. Then our PDF will be uploaded.

Conclusion

In this blog we learnt how to upload a Large Object PDF file to our application using ABAP Restful Programing.

entry.title: Re: Segment '_records' not allowed in the current context
entry.content:
After further investigation I found missing annotations in metadata extension file for my ZC_RECORDS a.k.a. _records.

@ui.identification: [{ position: 10 }] etc. Now it works as expected.

Let's call this an answer.

Regards,

Radim

entry.title: LMS OdataV4 XML Payload structure
entry.content:
Hi,

I'm trying to add learningHistory for users in LMS, but have some issues converting json payload to proper xml payload.

Some information:
Operation: POST
Address: */learning/odatav4/public/admin/learningEvent/v1/
Resource Path: recordLearningEvents
Using SAP CPI/CI, SuccessFactors Odatav4.

This is what I have in bruno, in json, which works fine:

{
 "@odata.type":"#recordLearningEvents",
 "recordLearningEvents" :
 [
 {
 "componentTypeID": "OTHER",
 "componentID": "ITEM_xxxxx",
 "studentID": "xxxxx",
 "completionStatusID":"OTHER-C",
 "completionDate": 1760689013000,
 "completionTimeZoneID": "Europe/Oslo",
 "grade": "A",
   "comments":"xxxxx"
 }
 ]
}

However, I cannot seem to convert it to XML properly in CPI. Every time I get either invalid recordLearningEvents or invalid componentTypeID. (It is valid).

Can someone point me in the right direction on how I should be performing these calls from CPI?

Thanks in advance,
Stian

entry.title: Re: CPI-Quicks #1: How to transform an IFlow Into an API Artifact
entry.content:
What is the purpose? 

I dont see much value in the REST or SOAP artifacts. Last time we checked they had much lower support for maintance and lifecycle. 

 

Daniel Graversen /Figaf

entry.title: Re: Valuation Price in Purchase Requisition App
entry.content:
Hi,
To make the valuation price field editable in the Fiori Create Purchase Requisition app, you need to adjust the configuration and extensibility settings tied to catalog-based items.

Following the steps to Make the Field Editable.
To enable editing of the valuation price in the Fiori app, consider these approaches:

1. Use Manual Entry Instead of Catalog
If you enter the material manually (not via catalog/cart), the valuation price field is typically editable.

This mimics ME51N behavior more closely.

2. Extend the Fiori App via In-App Extensibility
Use SAP Fiori Elements extensibility to modify the UI behavior.

You can enable the field for editing by adjusting the metadata annotations or customizing the UI logic.

This may require developer access and coordination with your SAP BASIS or Fiori development team.

3. Check Backend Configuration
Review the Material Master and Info Record settings:

If the price is maintained in the purchasing info record or contract, it may override manual entry.

You can also explore BAdIs or enhancement spots like ME_PROCESS_REQ_CUST to influence field behavior during PR creation.

4. SAP Notes or OSS Support
If this behavior is unexpected or inconsistent, check for relevant SAP Notes or raise a ticket with SAP Support.

Sometimes, newer versions of the Fiori app introduce changes that can be toggled via configuration.

Hope this message will help you.

entry.title: Re: CVI Conversion issue
entry.content:
Pls. have a look at https://me.sap.com/notes/2713963/E . Here it says:

What roles should be created as part of the synchronization direction from Customer/Vendor to BP?

If the standard configuration is followed, the expected roles after running CVI are:

    • For Suppliers: FLVN00, FLVN01
    • For Customers: FLCU00, FLCU01

Any additional roles needed will be created directly in SAP S/4HANA after running SUM. For example:

    • For Credit Management: The role UKM000 will be created during the execution of the FI post-conversion activities.

 

Hope it helps!

entry.title: Re: How are MT940 Transaction Keys Mapped to External Tra...
entry.content:
MT940 transaction code is external transaction code. If you import MT940 file, something will be read from the statement file and saved in the field "external transaction code", based on the MT940 type (structured, unstructured) and the list of codes that the bank uses. And then, to this codes, you can assign posting rules in SAP, in configuration in OT83 in SAP. You can also remap the external codes to different ones, usually more specific - if bank codes are too generic for correct determination of posting logic. But this remapping is possible in user exits only, as far as i know.

There is a bit of explanation in note: 3586660 - BTC/External transaction Code Extraction from Different Tag Lines in MT940 Statement

entry.title: Re: Global User ID and SAP IAS: Essentials for AI integration in SAP landscape
entry.content:
Hi @tskwin 

As mentioned, I'm NOT provisioning users with UUID attribute, I'm just using IAS UUID as Subject Name identifier mapped to "Custom SAML User Mapping". 

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_ANALYTICS_CLOUD/00f68c2e08b941f081002fd3691d86a7/3651184dad944aa2b361ad029a7a8cae.html

You can create the users in SAC automatically using the "dynamic user creation" option. There's no need to provision any user with the UUID to SAC using IPS in the scenario I'm mentioning. I'm just using UUID as Subject attribute for SSO. Everything is described in the help above and in the learning path.

https://learning.sap.com/courses/managing-security-and-administration-in-sap-analytics-cloud

entry.title: Re: RAP - Managed with Unmanaged Save
entry.content: Hi, just wondering. why did you choose the BAPI over the RAP BO I_EQUIPMENTTP? Also, are you creating a new application to update the equipment master data? May I know why you didn't use the standard application? Usually when we use the standard application, we can make use of released business events to update audit tables. But in your case, if both the released RAP BO and fiori app is not suitable, then your option as per MioYasutake is to use managed with unmanaged save and update the audit table from the save_modified method.

entry.title: SAP TechEd Berlin 2025: Discover SAP Cloud ALM for operations in action
entry.content:
A couple of words about me

My name is Stephanie Jerch, and I’m a Product Manager at SAP. 

As a Solution Expert in Product Management for SAP Cloud ALM for Operations, I empower customers to benefit from its use. Before joining SAP in 2015, I previously worked for SAP Partners in consulting roles focused on Application Lifecycle Management.  

My Session(s): 

CS101 | Discover SAP Cloud ALM for operations in action

🗓️ Wednesday, Nov 5 ⌚️ 11:15 AM - 12:00 PM CET 👉Deep Dive

What you will learn about: 

This session delves into the capabilities of SAP Cloud ALM for operations, providing a comprehensive overview of its landscape monitoring features. Participants will learn how to effectively monitor their SAP BTP environments through through the glasses of a customer. The session will highlight the latest features and functionalities. Additionally, attendees will gain an outlook on upcoming developments and works in progress, staying informed about the future direction of SAP Cloud ALM.

Co-speakers: 

Christian Niedermayer
Cross Architect, SAP SE		 Mirko Feisel
Lead BTP Plattform Engineer, Henkel AG & Co.KGaA

 

CS261 | Monitoring a custom SAP BTP application with SAP Cloud ALM for operations

🗓️ Wednesday, Nov 5. ⌚️ 3:30 PM - 5:30 PM CET 👉Hands-on Workshop

 What you will learn about: 

In this session, you will learn how to monitor a custom application on SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP), including instrumenting the services, configuring SAP Build Work Zone, embedding the SAP Cloud Logging service, and activating data collection in the SAP Cloud ALM tool. Monitor clicks with SAP Cloud ALM and SAP Cloud Logging and explore the latest features.

 Co-speakers: 

Christian Niedermayer
Cross Architect, SAP SE		Markus Bechler
Product Manager, SAP SE 		Stefan Lahr
Product Manager, SAP SE

Other related sessions I recommend:  

XP204 | Automate technical operation tasks for your applications on SAP BTP

Related community managed tags you should subscribe to remain informed about this topic: 

 SAP Cloud ALM SAP Business Technology Platform 

 Looking forward to seeing you: 

We're excited to have you join us as we explore the powerful capabilities of SAP Cloud ALM for operations. Let's dive in and discover how to optimize your landscape monitoring with live demos and insights into the latest features and AI innovations. Looking forward to an engaging and informative time together!

Now let’s hear from you: 

Turn the tides from reactive to proactive monitoring? What are your plans?

entry.title: What’s New on the SAP Analytics Cloud Homepage: 2025 Q4 QRC Enhancements!
entry.content:
The 2025 Q4 QRC release brings several welcome enhancements to the SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) Homepage that make personalization faster, admin controls more flexible, and metric monitoring easier. Whether you’re an end user customizing your view or a tenant admin managing resources, these updates streamline the experience and help you focus on what matters most.

Here’s a quick tour of what’s new and why it matters.

1. Resizable Cards!

Users can now resize homepage cards vertically, horizontally, or both (depending on card type). You can better prioritize content visually to enlarge a critical story or metric card to occupy more space, shrink ancillary cards, and create a layout that mirrors your workflow.

Hover over a card until resize handles appear, then drag to resize. The responsive grid will rearrange other cards intelligently to preserve your layout.

⚠️ Note: All cards are resizable, except the Quick Action card, which can only be resized by removing its quick actions.

2. Admin-Editable Resource Cards

For tenant administrators, managing and sharing critical information just got a whole lot easier. SAP Analytics Cloud tenant Admins can now edit the resource card by adding new custom resources. This means you can curate and provide direct links to essential internal documents, training materials, company portals, or any other relevant resources right from the homepage. Streamline access to vital information for your users and ensure everyone has what they need, exactly when they need it.

From the System Administration interface under Default Appearance, administrators will see a new Edit option on the resource card. Clicking the edit icon allows admins to add or remove links with a live preview of the card. Admins can also reset the resource card to its default appearance and restore the default links.

⚠️ Note: The card must contain at least one resource (default or custom) to save changes.

3. Unified Homepage and User Profile Settings

To provide a more cohesive and efficient user experience, SAP Analytics Cloud Homepage settings and User Profile Settings are now consolidated and unified in one intuitive interface. No more jumping between different menus to adjust your personal preferences and homepage layout. Everything you need to manage your personal workspace is now accessible from a single, convenient location, simplifying your personalization journey.

4. New "My Metrics" Card: Monitor Your Most Important Insights

We’re excited to introduce the brand-new “My Metrics” homepage card. This powerful new addition allows users to set up a personalized Metric List directly on their homepage. Monitor your most critical Metrics at a glance, ensuring you always have immediate visibility into your most important business drivers without needing to navigate away from your homepage.

You can select and load Metrics List owned by you or shared with you from the file reposotory in a very easy and simple way. By selecting a Metric from the card you will be redirected to My Metrics application where you will have a detailed overview of the selected Metrics. To learn more about My Metrics and its capabilities, please read this blog post.

5. A Fresh Look: The Horizon Theme is Here!

Embrace a modern and vibrant aesthetic! The Horizon theme is now enabled and can be easily set via your Homepage settings. This integration brings a fresh, contemporary design, aligning your SAC experience with the latest SAP Fiori guidelines. Enjoy a visually appealing and consistent interface that enhances readability and overall user satisfaction. To learn more about the new SAC themes, please read this blog post.

Features Not Supported on the New Homepage

The redesigned SAP Analytics Cloud homepage brings many improvements for easier access to content and quicker insight into updates. However, a few Home features are not available in the new experience:

  • Pin to Home: Because Pin to Home depends on Classic Stories (which will be deprecated in Q2 2026) and provides far fewer capabilities than My Metrics, we determined it is not a strategic feature and prioritized My Metrics to align with our analytics roadmap.
  • Recent Analytics Application, Recent Stories, and Recent Presentations: have been consolidated into a single card called “Recent files,” where you can view all your recent items and use filters to refine the card’s content.
  • New Home Screen Note
  • Get Started

⚠️ Note: the welcome message remains always enabled on the new homepage.

System administration settings that are not supported on the new home screen include:

  • Changing the background theme
  • Changing or setting a custom logo

We recommend that you backup any of your pinned widgets and notes from your old homepage for your own records. Content within the deprecated home cards are intact in the new Home, since you can filter the results of your recent files card to show your recent stories, recent presentations, and recent analytic applications. In addition, content within the favorites tab is intact in the favorites home card. The favorites card provides more control over how you can filter and search for your results.

These 2025 Q4 QRC release enhancements are all about putting more power, flexibility, and personalization into your hands, making your SAP Analytics Cloud experience more productive and enjoyable. We encourage you to explore these new features and tailor your homepage to truly reflect your unique workflow and priorities.

What’s Next!

In the upcoming SAC Homepage release, we’re rolling out Admin-focused cards and enhancements for Admin Personas: the new Admin Overview Console, Tenant Insights, Governance & Resources, and User Activity & Audit cards provide admins with fast access to management tools, tenant health metrics, and governance content. We encourage you to regularly consult our roadmap for upcoming updates.

Log in to your SAP Analytics Cloud tenant today and experience the difference!

entry.title: Re: CPI-Quicks #1: How to transform an IFlow Into an API Artifact
entry.content:
Thank you for your Question @DG 

At the moment, this serves only a semantic purpose, as the APIs do not differ from standard IFlows from a source perspective. For us, it is the initial step toward establishing a technical baseline for API based integration. When these artifacts are enhanced in upcoming releases, we will already be prepared for the new changes.

Regards
Aris

entry.title: How do you handle Terms & Conditions confirmation when external users purchase trainings in LMS?
entry.content:
Hi everyone!

We received feedback from our Legal department regarding the purchase of trainings in our SAP SuccessFactors LMS.

In our setup, external users can register on the learning portal and purchase trainings. During registration, they must already accept the platform’s Terms & Conditions.

According to Legal, even though users accept the conditions when they first register, they should confirm agreement again when purchasing a specific training. The reasoning is that each training purchase constitutes a separate contract. They suggested implementing a “checkbox solution” at the point of purchase, but also mentioned that a simple text reference to the consent agreement would be sufficient.

We’d like to know if other organizations have implemented this in practice within SAP SF LMS.

Do you display or reference the consent statements during each purchase flow? If so, how? Or do you rely on the general system behavior for consent acceptance and handle the contractual aspect differently?

Any feedback is highly appreciated. Thank you & best regards

Julia

entry.title: Re: Posting System-wide Messages Using "Manage News" App
entry.content: We explored the new MyHome for On-Premise on version 2023 (using FLP parameter: spaces.custom_home_component_id: ux.eng.s4producthomes1). That seemed to work. After an initial upgrade on a sap sandbox system On-Premise version 2025, nothing in the Custom MyHome seems to work. Is it supposed to work for On-Premise? Because then we could also not use this 'Manage News' system. Are we supposed to create our own UI5 app for MyHome and use that as an id for the FLP Parameter?

entry.title: Re: Accessing long text of SAP Master data Objects or fields in S4 Hana through a CDS View
entry.content:
All replicated SAPscript long texts in table esh_sr_ltxt are missing line breaks. So, this might not be the convenient all-purpose replacement it seemed to be.

Of course, CDS view I_TextObjectPlainLongText doesn't promise anything other than plain text. And in the originally intended context of (enterprise) search this seems to be fine.

However, the view is now part of the VDM of released BOs like I_MaintenanceOrderTP (S/4HANA 2023). Surely, line breaks should be supported there. What am I missing?

entry.title: ‌🇪🇸‌ Onsite in Barcelona: AUSAPE - Human Resources - Payroll and SAP SuccessFactors
entry.content:
Join us for an in-person event in Barcelona hosted by AUSAPE, the Spanish SAP User Group.
The agenda will feature relevant topics designed to inform and foster discussion among participants. This is an excellent opportunity to connect with peers and gain insights into key developments in SAP solutions.

Agenda:

9:30-10:00: Reception and Coffee.

10:00-10:15: Welcome by group coordinators:

·         Miguel ángel Gámez Latorre

·         José Domingo Mouriz Mayoral

10:15-11:15: StradaGlobal:  Digital transformation of Human Resources and Payroll: Strada's journey to SAP Cloud.

·         Francisco Quesada - SAP Professional Services - Global Business Leaders

·         Raul Camacho - Director Alliances, Innovation & Effectiveness SAP 

11:15-11:30: Break

11:30-12:30: Antonio de Ancos Cid: End of ECC HCM: ECP o H4S4: Is there any chance?

12:30-13:45: SAP Success Factors: Last enhacements

13:45-14:00: Break

14:00-14:20: SAP – Legal changes and improvements in SAP HCM

·         Gema Moraleda – SAP

14:20-14:30: Doubts and questions

Speakers:
Gema Moraleda, SAP
Diego Pineda, SAP
Josep Martin, SAP

Sign up today on the AUSAPE event calendar to join us in Barcelona!

If you want to connect with SAP users and experts to exchange on HCM topics for Spain, join the Spanish Human Capital Management Localization collaboration group.

entry.title: BAPI_PROCORDCONF_CREATE_TT does not show errors if no stock available (nor COGI!?)
entry.content:
Dear Experts

 

We have been using  co6n and for a long time and it works properly. I am trying to use the bapi BAPI_PROCORDCONF_CREATE_TT to do the same, mostly consumption of materials, in case there is an error (stock is not enough for instance) the movement should go to COGI. We use SP HANA since 2024.

I am testing in Se37 with a test sequence of BAPI_PROCORDCONF_CREATE_TT and later BAPI_TRANSACTION_COMMIT with the "X"

I started with a simple entry in tables TIMETICKETS (record with confirmation number and little more, no yield) GOODSMOVEMENTS and also LINK_CONF_GOODSMOV table.

When I do a confirmation with a simple good movement of 1 unit (I have 10.000 in stock in my test system) all goes well apparently. At least the movement 261 is shown in MB51 and the confirmation is recorded. Only it’s a bit weird that in CORT I do not see the movement attached to the confirmation but for the rest, even the reservation is reduced etc.

The trouble is when I test a wrong movement to create a COGI or “some error”. For instance I enter quantity 999999 in the BAPI to create a cogi.

I get no error or message in BAPI, even it says that the confirmation has been saved. Later after commit, nothing happens.

If I do a similar thing in the same order, it goes to COGI.

SO I am a bit confused 😞

entry.title: SAP QM results recording : attaching documents
entry.content:
Dear all,

I am planning to connect SAP QM with a web application.
Quality control result recording will be performed in the web app, and the recorded results should be stored in SAP QM.

Additionally, the possibility to attach documents (e.g. images, PDFs, etc.) at the MIC level during result recording will be enabled.

My questions are:

Which BAdI can be used to achieve this integration?

Where are the attached documents stored in SAP QM? Is there a specific table for them?

Thank you in advance for your help.

Best regards,
Soufiane

entry.title: Re: SF LMS Item Completion Rule for Assignment Profile
entry.content: ** comment removed **

entry.title: Re: How are MT940 Transaction Keys Mapped to External Transaction Keys in SAP Bank Statement Process
entry.content:
Hello @MalgorzataS,

Thanks for the response,

Suppose my bank statement (attached) uses field 61 as the transaction key. My requirement is to have separate G/L accounts for:

  • Incoming bank transfer

  • Incoming cheque

  • Outgoing transfer

  • Outgoing cheque

I have created four external transaction keys in SAP for these scenarios and defined the corresponding posting (processing) rules.

My question:
How does SAP determine which external transaction code is mapped to a specific transaction from the bank statement file? For example, how does SAP know whether a transaction in field 61 should be posted using the external key for incoming transfer or outgoing cheque? Is the mapping entirely based on configuration, or does SAP use logic from the MT940 file’s content (like amount sign or code combinations)? What setup or mapping is required to ensure each transaction is posted to the correct G/L account?

Any clarification on the technical flow or config steps for this mapping would be helpful.

Best Regards,

Nithin

entry.title: Re: HR Access to Performance Forms
entry.content:
Hi - We permissioned reporting. This is the path for our HR colleagues to access in progress or completed forms:

Report Center > Classic Reporting > All Reports by Type > Detailed Document Search

The Detail Document Search results allow you to Generate Report as a read-only version of the form. Traditional excel exports are also available.

entry.title: Re: How to make a pay scale level inactive.
entry.content: I wanted to accomplish this same thing with Pay Scale Level AND Pay Grade Level. I found this KBA today: 2559785 - How to Deactivate / Delimit PayScaleLevel - SAP for Me. I haven't asked for this change yet, but I plan to, hoping it might be a viable solution for us.

entry.title: Re: SF LMS Item Completion Rule for Assignment Profile
entry.content: Sorry @karenperez.  My experience shows that, in the current release,  the required operator for Item Completion is EQUALS. However, in some cases SuccessFactors changes this to MATCHES when you save the rules. This is a known issue acc. to Copilot. One workaround iIfound is to go back and copy one of your APs that works: copy everything including the item. Then, in the copy, swap out the item for the new desired one. Save the rules. That can sometimes preserve your EQUALS operator. I hope that SAP is trying to fix this 😞 .

entry.title: Re: Search for the BAdI to trigger a notification after s...
entry.content: Hi, is this BADI released? Ideally, the approach for this would be to use local/remote event consumption. However, currently in S4 2023, local event consumption is only supported for custom RAP BOs. The released events for standard RAP BOs cannot be consumed directly via local event consumption.

entry.title: Re: Success factor beginning
entry.content: Be aware that many of the 'learning' courses for SF Learning ere are really aimed at implementation. I've looked at a lot of them, and most are terrible.  They are not designed for LMS administrators. Stick with the SAP ones as suggested above. Also check out the free videos from TalenTeam.  Good luck, I had a difficult time finding training on administering the Learning module.

entry.title: Re: Purchase Order Item is not matched to Invoice Item in...
entry.content: Hello Linda, are there plans to expand the matching of purchase order items and invoice items to include data fields such as the Global Trade Item Number (GTIN) and/or the supplier material number? These two values appear on our suppliers' invoices and are much more suitable as matching objects than quantities, prices, and short descriptions, which in some cases may even be identical across multiple invoice items.

entry.title: Re: Maximum Number of Messages for SAP Cloud Platform Int...
entry.content: The scaling topic has continued to evolve over time, there are some internal developments that are in the testing phase, and we should start to see some more developments in 2026, though I cannot confirm the exact date the next enhancements will hit the roadmap.
